title: Which optional subject is better for scoring in the UPSC Mains? I'm a student from a science background, some people say that science subjects will not give you enough score. How do I overcome this dilemma? - Quora
tags: Union Public Service Commission of India

response.answer_text: With introduction of new system with one optional, the role of optional in deciding success and good rank in UPSC has declined via-a-vis earlier system of two optionals. If you had studied any one of your science subjects with interest and reasonable academic depth, you should opt for it and to fine tune your knowledge after perusal of last year papers you can join like-minded aspirants group or reputed coaching in your selected science optional. If you don’t feel comfortable with science subject optional you can opt for public ad as one of the scoring optionals and spill over of its course content in GS paper 2 and GS-4. Further, you will enjoy the subject if you harbour even a little interest in polity, government functioning and bureaucracy. The five principal advantages of pub ad as optional are: First, Public Ad is one of the finest optionals for UPSC with a thin syllabus and instrumentality of topics for GS paper II of Mains also, apart from some coverage of topics from polity through the study of Pub Ad Paper II (Indian Administration). Second, the probability of netting questions in UPSC mains exam from what you have studied is maximum for Public Administration due to TINA factor ( There is no alternative). The TINA factor is on account of thin syllabus of the Pub Ad, UPSC has no option but to ask questions from the limited expanse of the subject. Third, it is one of the few optionals that can be covered in three months serious study of 6–8 hours daily. Never get hoodwinked with those who compare it with Anthro, Sociology, Pol Science. The syllabus of these subjects ( Anthro, Sociology, Pol Science) can drown you, especially if had no academic background in undergraduate or PG study. Fourth, the close examination of GS paper 4 (Ethics) 2018 question paper will amply clear the fact that no more UPSC asks commonplace questions rather technical questions are being asked in jargon-free simple language which is in the ambit of Public Adm viz. foundational values of public service, public interest, RTI as accountability concept etc.. (For more See references to answers of questions in the trustworthy book for Ethics GS IV for UPSC Which is a trustworthy book on ethics integrity and aptitude for civil services preparation? ). Fifth, the last advantage is also interesting in the sense that you are already acquainted with the theory and structure of your job as the public/civil servant when you qualify UPSC mains. You know your professional habitat much better than successful candidates with other optionals. The few indispensable books for Public Ad for Mains UPSC are: Public Ad by B L Fadia Two Books by Mohit Bhattacharya: New Horizons.. and Restructuring Pub Ad a new look.. Administrative Thinkers by Prasad and Prasad Indian Public Administration: Institutions and Issues by R.K. Arora IGNOU BA notes for Indian Administration. Ethics, Integrity, and Aptitude in Governance by Ranvijay Upadhyay The last one is also immensely helpful for students of Public Administration optional as aspirants may answer to questions in Pub Ad Mains paper 2018, worth 175 marks in Paper I and 120 marks in Paper II in a very structured, logical, and marks fetching manner.  PUBLIC ADMINISTRATION Mains 2018 PAPER I : Questions with answers in SAGE Ethics book: Question No. 1(b), 1(d), 2 (b), 3(b), 4 (c), 5(c), 6(a), 6(b), 6(c), 8(a), 8(b), 8(c). PAPER II : Questions with answers in SAGE Ethics book: Question No. . 1(b), 1(d), 1(e), 2 (a), 2 (c), 4 (c), 5(a), 5(d), 6(a), 6(b), 6(c), 8(a) .

Any subject is good provided you have material, interest in the subject and expert guidance. I am from science background and an engineer myself, and my optional is Political science and International relations and i really enjoy this subject. Dont fall into traps, marks dont come because one or more of the above three things are missing. If you need guidance for Pol.science i will be happy to help.
